metadata.title: CVE-2015-7802 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
gifread.c in gif2png, as used in OptiPNG before 0.7.6, allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (uninitialized memory read) via acrafted GIF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7802` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

optipng - 0.6.4-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: optipng package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.4-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
